Header: President says those against death penalty are against the task of building a better country
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena has said that those who are against the granting of death penalty to drug traffickers amount to opposing the programme of building a virtuous country.  He made this observation participating in a Pinkama held in Bandarawela. The handing over of the Act of appointment to the Ven. Galgodagama Sobitha Thera who had been feted with the Uva Provincial Chief Sanghanayake of the Amarapura Sirisaddhammawansa Maha Nikaya took place at the Bandarawela Town Hall auditorium. The Act of Appointment was handed over by President Maithripala Sirisena. The Ven. Sobitha Thera has completed an exemplary priesthood for 47 years. And has authored many books on the Buddhist philosophy.  The new Sanghanayake post has been bestowed on the Ven. Galgodagama Sobitha Thera assessing the task he is discharging in a significant religious and social service heading four Vihares. President Maithripala Sirisena handed over the Vijinipatha. A large gathering including members of the Maha Sangha. Peoples representatives and devotees joined in this Pinkama. Meanwhile the President also vested in the students the new two storied building of the Thotalagala Tamil School of Haputale. Built at a cost of nine million rupees the classroom building is equipped with all facilities. After inaugurating the building the President undertook an inspection tour. A sapling was planted at the school premises to mark the President’s visit. President Maithripala Sirisena drew his attention to the Graduate teacher issue to the Estate sector. The President emphasized that he would undertake the necessary mediation to find a solution to the problems after discussions with the Ministry of Education and the Provincial Council.
